body_html:
I think the ones derived from object are called new-style classes or something like that.

I have patched is_storage and is_tensor to have:
getattr(obj, "__class__", None) in _storage_classes. It has solved the issue.

It may still be good to make is_tensor and is_storage to be robust to objects of old-style classes.
body_text:
I think the ones derived from object are called new-style classes or something like that.
I have patched is_storage and is_tensor to have:
getattr(obj, "__class__", None) in _storage_classes. It has solved the issue.
It may still be good to make is_tensor and is_storage to be robust to objects of old-style classes.
body:
I think the ones derived from object are called new-style classes or something like that.

I have patched `is_storage` and `is_tensor` to have:
`getattr(obj, "__class__", None) in _storage_classes`. It has solved the issue.

It may still be good to make is_tensor and is_storage to be robust to objects of old-style classes.
